comments.body: `# noinspection PyTypeChecker` - Why do we need this?

We need it here to remove some annoying complaints from the IDE. I try to keep 0 warnings (i.e. green checkmark) while developing to catch stupid typos more easily. In this case discovery API does a lot of meta-programming and a lot of python objects returned have some duck-typed methods and silencing those warnings here helps to keep the green mark.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +276,280 @@        while True:
            if zone is None:
                # noinspection PyTypeChecker
                operation_response = self._check_global_operation_status(
                    service, operation_name, project_id)
